author: Byron Tau
title: Gina Haspel Says CIA Shouldn’t Have Run Interrogation Program
text:
WASHINGTON—The nominee to lead the Central Intelligence Agency, looking to shore up support before a confirmation vote this week, asserted that her agency shouldn’t have undertaken a program of detention and interrogation that many critics say amounted to torture.
Gina Haspel wrote in a letter released Tuesday that the post-9/11 program aimed at extracting intelligence from terrorism suspects “ultimately did damage to our officers and our standing in the world.”
... RELATED VIDEO How the Math Looks for CIA Pick Gina Haspel Will Gina Haspel be confirmed to lead the CIA? Gerald F. Seib examines which senators will likely vote to support or oppose her nomination, as she looks to reach a majority. Photo: Getty Images
